events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident involving a rear-end collision on the highway causing moderate damage to the rear bumper.
The claim was categorised as an auto accident based on the submitted initial report including details of the vehicle and incident.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the case and contacted the insured to gather more information about the accident.
The claim acknowledgment was sent promptly to the customer confirming receipt and initiating the next steps in the investigation.
Requested additional documents from the insured including photos of vehicle damage, police report, and repair estimates.
The insured successfully submitted all requested documentation via the claims portal to support processing and validation.
Claims investigation has commenced to assess the extent of damages, liability, and verify details provided by the insured.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the insured was not at fault and damages are eligible under the policy.
A settlement offer was proposed to the insured based on repair estimates and policy coverage limits for approval.
The insured responded positively to the settlement proposal indicating satisfaction and willingness to proceed.
The claim has been officially approved after review of all documents and acceptance of settlement terms by the insured.
Payment corresponding to the approved claim amount was issued to the insuredâ€™s bank account for vehicle repairs.
The claim file was closed after confirmation that repairs were completed satisfactorily and no further issues reported.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived in the system for future reference and regulatory compliance.
